name: The Amazing Swedish Meatball
author: KANDIYOHIV
summary: Yowza! These Swedish Meatballs are fabulous! Very easy to make with such simple ingredients, and they're just delicious. This recipe has been in my family for years - friends and family wait all year to eat them.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish
In a large bowl, combine ground beef, ground pork, chopped onion, bread crumbs, egg, and milk
Season with parsley, Worcestershire sauce, 2 teaspoons salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper
Shape into walnut-size balls, and place on baking dish
Bake for 30 minutes in preheated oven
Turn frequently so they brown evenly on all sides
To make the sauce:  In a saucepan, combine oil, flour, paprika, 1 tablespoon salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper
Cook over medium heat until sizzling
Stir in hot water and sour cream until smooth and heated through
When meatballs have cooked 30 minutes, pour sauce over the top, and return to the oven for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally
